title: EDAIF Approves GH¢28.5m For 135 Recipients
text:
25 August 2015 15:51 CET EDAIF Approves GH¢28.5m For 135 Recipients By Daily Guide 
Dr Barfour Osei The Export Trade, Agricultural and Industrial Development Fund (EDAIF) continues to provide significant support to Ghanaian producers and entrepreneurs. 
Over the last three months, it has approved a total amount of GH¢28.5 million to 135 beneficiaries in both the public and private sectors. 
Specific sectors that received the funding include poultry, agricultural production, agro-processing and manufacturing. 
The export trade, agriculture and industry-related activities of three public sector institutions were also supported to enable them implement a number of projects. 
A new phase of the EDAIF-funded mango project, which is in its sixth year of implementation, was also supported. 
The financial support was approved to expand mango cultivation by an additional 2,800 acres in all regions of the country this year. 
The board and management of EDAIF encouraged smallholder Ghanaian cooperatives, associations and businesses to contact it for further assistance.
